result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan C Gauger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Warrant was canceled.  Talked to Rhonda at GLSO.
sent to GLSO April 7, 2017
from Clerk to Defendant re: Warrant

1:14 pm
No Appearance by Defendant.  Court orders Warrant.
Court adjourned at 1:14 pm
FTP Hearing March 27, 2017, for $831.00

ADDRESS INFO for Ryan C Gauger
Current: W4569 South Pearl Lake Rd, Redgranite, WI 54970 United States  (Effective: 11-08-2016)
Prior: 164 S Wisconsin St Apt A Upper, Berlin, WI 54923 

(per defendant in person)

10:21 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with the repeater, with a fine, costs and DNA sample.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$300 fine plus costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 10:27 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

1:45 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joey Roeth present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - have Discovery and offer and defendant will accept the offer.  Corut sets for plea & sentencing on November 8, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:46 p.m.
State's
For Discovery-Defendant's
Attorney Joey Roeth
Status hearing on October 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

2:17 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - has been an appointed a public defender.  Court sets for Status Hearing on October 4, 2016 at 1:30 p.m..

Court adjourned at 2:18 p.m.
Status hearing on August 22, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

11:03 a.m.  No Appearance by the defendant.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders a warrant - stayed until August 22, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.  If no appearance warrant - forthwith.

Court adjourned at 11:04 a.m.
Status hearing on August 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.

9:00 a.m. Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Court will set for Status Hearing on August 15, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:02 a.m.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
